result.execSummary:
The defendant Raphael J Armstrong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raphael J Armstrong is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raphael J Armstrong was found guilty of Burglary-Armed w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.

$528  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victims or co-def.
Completion of aggression/anger management treatment if agent requests.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Credit does NOT apply.

AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP
- The Court finds that Cash Bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $200 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on Wedensday 6-18-14 if defendant has posted bond, or shall report ot DCBM on the business day following his release from jail.
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
